Today I want to talk about diplomacy. From my perspective, diplomacy in todayâ€™s world is nothing more than a bitter joke.

Why Diplomacy Feels Useless

The world is on the brink of a massive mess, and diplomacy seems powerless.
For example:

  • Negotiations are happening on one side.
  • Yet at the same time, Israel attacked Iran.

:::warning When diplomacy fails to prevent violence, its role becomes questionable. :::

Beyond Iran

This is not only about Iran. Slowly but surely, these conflicts are spreading across the globe.

"Whether we like it or not, diplomacy doesnâ€™t carry the same weight it used to."

We must face the fact that diplomacy is losing its influence worldwide.

A Troubling Future

If this trend continues, the world may head toward a major war.
Diplomatic talks and agreements will likely remain words on paper, while reality plays out differently.

:::note History shows us: when dialogue fails, war often takes its place. :::

item.title: Stress is your freind.
item.content:encoded:
Today I wanna talk about stress, something every person has experienced at least once. First things first, stress is often seen as harmful â€” at least thatâ€™s what we used to think.

Stress and Health Studies

Let me start with a study. This research tracked 30,000 adults in the US for eight years.

They asked people: â€œHow much stress have you experienced in the last year?â€
And also: â€œDo you believe that stress is harmful for your health?â€

People who experienced a lot of stress in the previous year had 43% increased risk of dying.

Interestingly, Oxytocin, the so-called â€œhormone of stress,â€ affects your brain and body, protecting your cardiovascular system from damage that stress might cause.

So generally, stress is your friend â€” until you believe itâ€™s harmful.

Helping Others Reduces Stress Risk

Another study tracked about 1,000 adults in the U.S., aged 34 to 93.

They asked how much stress participants had and how much time they spent helping friends or others.

Stress Event Risk of Dying If Helping Others
Major stress +30% 0%

For each major stressful event, the risk of dying increased by 30% â€” but not for those who helped others.

Helping others can actually protect us from the harmful effects of stress. Being together is a key way to manage stress. Stress gives us access to our hearts, both literally and metaphorically.

Mindset Matters

When you change your mind, you can change your bodyâ€™s response to stress.
Stress isnâ€™t inherently bad â€” itâ€™s our perception of it that determines its effect.

:::tip Engage in social activities, help others, and maintain a positive mindset to turn stress into a tool rather than a threat. :::

:::note Even though stress can feel overwhelming, remember that it can also boost resilience and strengthen connections with others. :::

Understanding stress this way can transform how you deal with it daily.
Next time you feel stressed, think of it as your friend giving you access to your heart and helping you grow.
